{"step_by_step_thinking": "A non-parametric test is a type of statistical test that does not assume our data follows a specific distribution. Pearson correlation, ANOVA, and Student t test are parametric tests because they assume that the data follows a certain distribution, usually a normal distribution. On the other hand, the Mann-Whitney test is a non-parametric test because it does not make any assumptions about the distribution of the data.", "answer_choice": "C"}
